Welcome to the Web Audio Conference 2025!
and to this presentation of a WebAudio powered
Interactive, Multiplayer...
Collaborative Music Making Musical Instrument,
for INSTANT musical superpowers!
allowing upto a quartet of players...
to jam together without any skill requirement
Where each person has their part of the song
From leads to basses to percussion
This is a PhotoSYNTH...
A SMILE POWERED SYNTHESIZER =D
Accessible musical instrument
(and super pop video machine!)
Part of the Accessible Musical Instrument Collection
A showcase of musical instruments built for everybody
Available to the public at RichMIX in central London, UK
Create Music guided by your expressions and moods
Using realtime motion capture and facial landmark tracking
Movements are tied to musical events,
Shaped by your emotions and intentions
To connect with the world of musical instruments
And to control the sounds of other devices
The MIDI protocol is fully integrated
Allowing your face to control your entire studio
And for your moods to control your sounds
With the support of MASSIG...
The MIDI Association Special Interest Group
- An open group dedicated to accessibilty...
and for the advancement of inclusive music technology -
We are working on open standards for MIDI2.0
With new ways to represent expressions
for making music in entirely new forms
We HOPE to see them in a browser like this very soon
as MIDI2.0 is the biggest update to music science in 40 years!
To play this musical instrument :
Smile or open your mouth to begin!
Change instruments and video effects by posing...
like your favourite emoji =P
Each expression will change the sound
Smile to add a Major flavour
Frown to add a melancholic character
or cringe, kiss, cry to hear how it sounds
Tilt, twist and bend your neck
to change between notes and octaves
Your job is to make some beautiful music
and collaborate with friends
To make even more interesting music
Technical implementation is pure javascript
As controlling every schedule is critical to deliver uninterupted audio
Timing and graphics are handled by Workers
Audio has a few modes depending on the power of the device
AudioWorklets are available as are WAM and WAM2
There is also a built in custom OscillatorNode synth engine
Though the main user feedback has always been...
Can you make it sound like a guitar?
So SoundFonts are the default technology
Synchronisation is possible if your clock is accurate
So many PhotoSYNTHs can play together...
While state is stored in the URL so you can share
with friends, or continue playing at home.
There is also MIDI file saving and stream recording
using OPFS with Workers to encode audio and video
It also works with the Holographic displays from Looking Glass!
Scan the QR code on the right to continue playing on your own device
And carry on the fun at home!
Or you can go to interface.place
Or photosynth.app to learn more.
